The current position is updated after each text output call. The current position is used as the reference point.

remarks.para: By default, the current position is not used or updated by this function. However, an application can call the SetTextAlign function with the fMode parameter set to TA_UPDATECP to permit the system to use and update the current position each time the application calls TextOut for a specified device context. When this flag is set, the system ignores the nXStart and nYStart parameters on subsequent TextOut calls.

When the TextOut function is placed inside a path bracket, the system generates a path for the TrueType text that includes each character plus its character box. The region generated is the character box minus the text, rather than the text itself. You can obtain the region enclosed by the outline of the TrueType text by setting the background mode to transparent before placing the TextOut function in the path bracket. Following is sample code that demonstrates this procedure.
Examples
For an example, see Enumerating the Installed Fonts.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ABC
member.summary: The ABC structure contains the width of a character in a TrueType font.
member.remarks: The total width of a character is the summation of the A, B, and C spaces. Either the A or the C space can be negative to indicate underhangs or overhangs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ABC.abcA
member.summary: The A spacing of the character. The A spacing is the distance to add to the current position before drawing the character glyph.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ABC.abcB
member.summary: The B spacing of the character. The B spacing is the width of the drawn portion of the character glyph.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ABC.abcC
member.summary: The C spacing of the character. The C spacing is the distance to add to the current position to provide white space to the right of the character glyph.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ABCFLOAT
member.summary: The ABCFLOAT structure contains the A, B, and C widths of a font character.

remarks.para: The A, B, and C widths are measured along the base line of the font.
The character increment (total width) of a character is the sum of the A, B, and C spaces. Either the A or the C space can be negative to indicate underhangs or overhangs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ABCFLOAT.abcfA
member.summary: The A spacing of the character. The A spacing is the distance to add to the current position before drawing the character glyph.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ABCFLOAT.abcfB
member.summary: The B spacing of the character. The B spacing is the width of the drawn portion of the character glyph.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ABCFLOAT.abcfC
member.summary: The C spacing of the character. The C spacing is the distance to add to the current position to provide white space to the right of the character glyph.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.AXESLIST
member.summary: The AXESLIST structure contains information on all the axes of a multiple master font.

remarks.para: The PostScript Open Type Font does not support multiple master functionality.

The information on the axes of a multiple master font are specified by the AXISINFO structures. The axlNumAxes member specifies the actual size of axlAxisInfo, while MM_MAX_NUMAXES, which equals 16, is the maximum allowed size of axlAxisInfo.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.AXESLIST.axlReserved
member.summary: Reserved. Must be STAMP_AXESLIST.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.AXESLIST.axlNumAxes
member.summary: Number of axes for a specified multiple master font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.AXESLIST.axlAxisInfo
member.summary: An array of AXISINFO structures. Each AXISINFO structure contains information on an axis of a specified multiple master font. This corresponds to the dvValues array in the DESIGNVECTOR structure.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.AXISINFO
member.summary: The AXISINFO structure contains information about an axis of a multiple master font.

remarks.para: The AXISINFO structure contains the name of an axis in a multiple master font and also the minimum and maximum possible values for the axis. The length of the name is MM_MAX_AXES_NAMELEN, which equals 16. An application queries these values before setting its desired values in the DESIGNVECTOR array.
The PostScript Open Type Font does not support multiple master functionality.
For the ANSI version of this structure, axAxisName must be an array of bytes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.AXISINFO.axMinValue
member.summary: The minimum value for this axis.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.AXISINFO.axMaxValue
member.summary: The maximum value for this axis.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.AXISINFO.axAxisName
member.summary: The name of the axis, specified as an array of characters.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.DESIGNVECTOR
member.summary: The DESIGNVECTOR structure is used by an application to specify values for the axes of a multiple master font.

remarks.para: The dvNumAxes member determines the actual size of dvValues, and thus, of DESIGNVECTOR. The constant MM_MAX_NUMAXES, which is 16, specifies the maximum allowed size of the dvValues array.
The PostScript Open Type Font does not support multiple master functionality.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.DESIGNVECTOR.dvReserved
member.summary: Reserved. Must be STAMP_DESIGNVECTOR.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.DESIGNVECTOR.dvNumAxes
member.summary: Number of values in the dvValues array.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.DESIGNVECTOR.dvValues
member.summary: An array specifying the values of the axes of a multiple master OpenType font. This array corresponds to the axlAxisInfo array in the AXESLIST structure.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONT
member.summary: The ENUMLOGFONT structure defines the attributes of a font, the complete name of a font, and the style of a font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONT.elfLogFont
member.summary: A LOGFONT structure that defines the attributes of a font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONT.elfFullName
member.summary: A unique name for the font. For example, ABCD Font Company TrueType Bold Italic Sans Serif.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONT.elfStyle
member.summary: The style of the font. For example, Bold Italic.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONTEX
member.summary: The ENUMLOGFONTEX structure contains information about an enumerated font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONTEX.elfLogFont
member.summary: A LOGFONT structure that contains values defining the font attributes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONTEX.elfFullName
member.summary: The unique name of the font. For example, ABC Font Company TrueType Bold Italic Sans Serif.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONTEX.elfStyle
member.summary: The style of the font. For example, Bold Italic.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONTEX.elfScript
member.summary: The script, that is, the character set, of the font. For example, Cyrillic.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONTEXDV
member.summary: The ENUMLOGFONTEXDV structure contains the information used to create a font.

remarks.para: The actual size of ENUMLOGFONTEXDV depends on that of DESIGNVECTOR, which, in turn depends on its dvNumAxes member.
The EnumFonts, EnumFontFamilies, and EnumFontFamiliesEx functions have been modified to return pointers to ENUMTEXTMETRIC and ENUMLOGFONTEXDV to the callback function.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONTEXDV.elfEnumLogfontEx
member.summary: An ENUMLOGFONTEX structure that contains information about the logical attributes of the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMLOGFONTEXDV.elfDesignVector
member.summary: A DESIGNVECTOR structure. This is zero-filled unless the font described is a multiple master OpenType font.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.ENUMTEXTMETRIC
member.summary: The ENUMTEXTMETRIC structure contains information about a physical font.

remarks.para: ENUMTEXTMETRIC is an extension of NEWTEXTMETRICEX that includes the axis information for a multiple master font.
The EnumFonts, EnumFontFamilies, and EnumFontFamiliesEx functions have been modified to return pointers to the ENUMTEXTMETRIC and ENUMLOGFONTEXDV structures.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.FONTSIGNATURE
member.summary: Contains information identifying the code pages and Unicode subranges for which a given font provides glyphs.
member.remarks: GDI relies on Windows code pages fitting within a 32-bit value. Furthermore, the highest 2 bits within this value are reserved for GDI internal use and may not be assigned to code pages.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.FONTSIGNATURE.fsUsb
member.summary: A 128-bit Unicode subset bitfield (USB) identifying up to 126 Unicode subranges. Each bit, except the two most significant bits, represents a single subrange. The most significant bit is always 1 and identifies the bitfield as a font signature; the second most significant bit is reserved and must be 0. Unicode subranges are numbered in accordance with the ISO 10646 standard. For more information, see Unicode Subset Bitfields.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.FONTSIGNATURE.fsCsb
member.summary: A 64-bit, code-page bitfield (CPB) that identifies a specific character set or code page. Code pages are in the lower 32 bits of this bitfield. The high 32 are used for non-Windows code pages. For more information, see Code Page Bitfields.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GCP_RESULTS
member.summary: The GCP_RESULTS structure contains information about characters in a string. This structure receives the results of the GetCharacterPlacement function. For some languages, the first element in the arrays may contain more, language-dependent information.

remarks.para: Whether the lpGlyphs, lpOutString, or neither is required depends on the results of the GetFontLanguageInfo call.

In the case of a font for a language such as English, in which none of the GCP_DBCS, GCP_REORDER, GCP_GLYPHSHAPE, GCP_LIGATE, GCP_DIACRITIC, or GCP_KASHIDA flags are returned, neither of the arrays is required for proper operation. (Though not required, they can still be used. If the lpOutString array is used, it will be exactly the same as the lpInputString passed to GetCharacterPlacement.) Note, however, that if GCP_MAXEXTENT is used, then lpOutString will contain the truncated string if it is used, NOT an exact copy of the original.

In the case of fonts for languages such as Hebrew, which DO have reordering but do not typically have extra glyph shapes, lpOutString should be used. This will give the string on the screen-readable order. However, the lpGlyphs array is not typically needed. (Hebrew can have extra glyphs, if the font is a TrueType/Open font.)

In the case of languages such as Thai or Arabic, in which GetFontLanguageInfo returns the GCP_GLYPHSHAPE flag, the lpOutString will give the display-readable order of the string passed to GetCharacterPlacement, but the values will still be the unshaped characters. For proper display, the lpGlyphs array must be used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GCP_RESULTS.lStructSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GCP_RESULTS.lpOutString
member.summary: A pointer to the buffer that receives the output string or is NULL if the output string is not needed. The output string is a version of the original string that is in the order that will be displayed on a specified device. Typically the output string is identical to the original string, but may be different if the string needs reordering and the GCP_REORDER flag is set or if the original string exceeds the maximum extent and the GCP_MAXEXTENT flag is set.

summary.para: A pointer to the array that receives ordering indexes or is NULL if the ordering indexes are not needed. However, its meaning depends on the other elements of GCP_RESULTS. If glyph indexes are to be returned, the indexes are for the lpGlyphs array; if glyphs indexes are not returned and lpOrder is requested, the indexes are for lpOutString. For example, in the latter case the value of lpOrder[i] is the position of lpString[i] in the output string lpOutString.

This is typically used when GetFontLanguageInfo returns the GCP_REORDER flag, which indicates that the original string needs reordering. For example, in Hebrew, in which the text runs from right to left, the lpOrder array gives the exact locations of each element in the original string.

A pointer to the array that receives the distances between adjacent character cells or is NULL if these distances are not needed. If glyph rendering is done, the distances are for the glyphs not the characters, so the resulting array can be used with the ExtTextOut function.
The distances in this array are in display order. To find the distance for the i character in the original string, use the lpOrder array as follows:
width = lpDx[lpOrder[i]];

A pointer to the array that receives the caret position values or is NULL if caret positions are not needed. Each value specifies the caret position immediately before the corresponding character. In some languages the position of the caret for each character may not be immediately to the left of the character. For example, in Hebrew, in which the text runs from right to left, the caret position is to the right of the character. If glyph ordering is done, lpCaretPos matches the original string, not the output string. This means that some adjacent values may be the same.
The values in this array are in input order. To find the caret position value for the i character in the original string, use the array as follows:
position = lpCaretPos[i];

A pointer to the array that contains and/or receives character classifications. The values indicate how to lay out characters in the string and are similar (but not identical) to the CT_CTYPE2 values returned by the GetStringTypeEx function. Each element of the array can be set to zero or one of the following values.

item.term: Character from a Latin or other single-byte character set for a left-to-right language.
Digit from a Latin or other single-byte character set for a left-to-right language.
Digit from the character set associated with the current font.

summary.para: In addition, the following can be used when supplying values in the lpClass array with the GCP_CLASSIN flag.

item.term: Input only. Character used to separate Latin digits, such as a comma or decimal point.
Input only. Character used to terminate Latin digits, such as a plus or minus sign.
Input only. Character has no specific classification.
Input only. Character used to separate digits, such as a comma or decimal point.

summary.para: For languages that use the GCP_REORDER flag, the following values can also be used with the GCP_CLASSIN flag. Unlike the preceding values, which can be used anywhere in the lpClass array, all of the following values are used only in the first location in the array. All combine with other classifications.
Note that GCPCLASS_PREBOUNDLTR and GCPCLASS_PREBOUNDRTL are mutually exclusive, as are GCPCLASSPOSTBOUNDLTR and GCPCLASSPOSTBOUNDRTL.

item.term: Set lpClass[0] to GCPCLASS_PREBOUNDLTR to bind the string to left-to-right reading order before the string.
Set lpClass[0] to GCPCLASS_PREBOUNDRTL to bind the string to right-to-left reading order before the string.
Set lpClass[0] to GCPCLASS_POSTBOUNDLTR to bind the string to left-to-right reading order after the string.
Set lpClass[0] to GCPCLASS_POSTBOUNDRTL to bind the string to right-to-left reading order after the string.

summary.para: To force the layout of a character to be carried out in a specific way, preset the classification for the corresponding array element; the function leaves such preset classifications unchanged and computes classifications only for array elements that have been set to zero. Preset classifications are used only if the GCP_CLASSIN flag is set and the lpClass array is supplied.
If GetFontLanguageInfo does not return GCP_REORDER for the current font, only the GCPCLASS_LATIN value is meaningful.

A pointer to the array that receives the values identifying the glyphs used for rendering the string or is NULL if glyph rendering is not needed. The number of glyphs in the array may be less than the number of characters in the original string if the string contains ligated glyphs. Also if reordering is required, the order of the glyphs may not be sequential.

This array is useful if more than one operation is being done on a string which has any form of ligation, kerning or order-switching. Using the values in this array for subsequent operations saves the time otherwise required to generate the glyph indices each time.
This array always contains glyph indices and the ETO_GLYPH_INDEX value must always be used when this array is used with the ExtTextOut function.

When GCP_LIGATE is used, you can limit the number of characters that will be ligated together. (In Arabic for example, three-character ligations are common). This is done by setting the maximum required in lpGcpResults->lpGlyphs[0]. If no maximum is required, you should set this field to zero.

For languages such as Arabic, where GetFontLanguageInfo returns the GCP_GLYPHSHAPE flag, the glyphs for a character will be different depending on whether the character is at the beginning, middle, or end of a word. Typically, the first character in the input string will also be the first character in a word, and the last character in the input string will be treated as the last character in a word. However, if the displayed string is a subset of the complete string, such as when displaying a section of scrolled text, this may not be true. In these cases, it is desirable to force the first or last characters to be shaped as not being initial or final forms. To do this, again, the first location in the lpGlyphs array is used by performing an OR operation of the ligation value above with the values GCPGLYPH_LINKBEFORE and/or GCPGLYPH_LINKAFTER. For example, a value of GCPGLYPH_LINKBEFORE | 2 means that two-character ligatures are the maximum required, and the first character in the string should be treated as if it is in the middle of a word.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GCP_RESULTS.nGlyphs
member.summary: On input, this member must be set to the size of the arrays pointed to by the array pointer members. On output, this is set to the number of glyphs filled in, in the output arrays. If glyph substitution is not required (that is, each input character maps to exactly one glyph), this member is the same as it is on input.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GCP_RESULTS.nMaxFit
member.summary: The number of characters that fit within the extents specified by the nMaxExtent parameter of the GetCharacterPlacement function. If the GCP_MAXEXTENT or GCP_JUSTIFY value is set, this value may be less than the number of characters in the original string. This member is set regardless of whether the GCP_MAXEXTENT or GCP_JUSTIFY value is specified. Unlike nGlyphs, which specifies the number of output glyphs, nMaxFit refers to the number of characters from the input string. For Latin SBCS languages, this will be the same.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GCP_RESULTS.Default
member.summary: The default instance of this structure with the structure size value set.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GLYPHMETRICS
member.summary: The GLYPHMETRICS structure contains information about the placement and orientation of a glyph in a character cell.
member.remarks: Values in the GLYPHMETRICS structure are specified in device units.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GLYPHMETRICS.gmBlackBoxX
member.summary: The width of the smallest rectangle that completely encloses the glyph (its black box).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GLYPHMETRICS.gmBlackBoxY
member.summary: The height of the smallest rectangle that completely encloses the glyph (its black box).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GLYPHMETRICS.gmptGlyphOrigin
member.summary: The x- and y-coordinates of the upper left corner of the smallest rectangle that completely encloses the glyph.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GLYPHMETRICS.gmCellIncX
member.summary: The horizontal distance from the origin of the current character cell to the origin of the next character cell.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GLYPHMETRICS.gmCellIncY
member.summary: The vertical distance from the origin of the current character cell to the origin of the next character cell.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GLYPHSET

member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure.

summary.para: Flags describing the maximum size of the glyph indices. This member can be the following value.

item.term: Treat glyph indices as 8-bit wide values. Otherwise, they are 16-bit wide values.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GLYPHSET.cGlyphsSupported
member.summary: The total number of Unicode code points supported in the font.

member.summary: The total number of Unicode ranges in ranges.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.GLYPHSET.ranges

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.KERNINGPAIR
member.summary: The KERNINGPAIR structure defines a kerning pair.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.KERNINGPAIR.wFirst
member.summary: The character code for the first character in the kerning pair.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.KERNINGPAIR.wSecond
member.summary: The character code for the second character in the kerning pair.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.KERNINGPAIR.iKernAmount
member.summary: The amount this pair will be kerned if they appear side by side in the same font and size. This value is typically negative, because pair kerning usually results in two characters being set more tightly than normal. The value is specified in logical units; that is, it depends on the current mapping mode.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.MAT2
member.summary: The MAT2 structure contains the values for a transformation matrix used by the GetGlyphOutline function.
member.remarks: The identity matrix produces a transformation in which the transformed graphical object is identical to the source object. In the identity matrix, the value of eM11 is 1, the value of eM12 is zero, the value of eM21 is zero, and the value of eM22 is 1.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.MAT2.eM11
member.summary: A fixed-point value for the M11 component of a 3 by 3 transformation matrix.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.MAT2.eM12
member.summary: A fixed-point value for the M12 component of a 3 by 3 transformation matrix.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.MAT2.eM21
member.summary: A fixed-point value for the M21 component of a 3 by 3 transformation matrix.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.MAT2.eM22
member.summary: A fixed-point value for the M22 component of a 3 by 3 transformation matrix.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.MAT2.IdentityMatrix
member.summary: The identity matrix value.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC
member.summary: The NEWTEXTMETRIC structure contains data that describes a physical font.

remarks.para: The last four members of the NEWTEXTMETRIC structure are not included in the TEXTMETRIC structure; in all other respects, the structures are identical.
The sizes in the NEWTEXTMETRIC structure are typically specified in logical units; that is, they depend on the current mapping mode of the display context.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmHeight
member.summary: The height (ascent + descent) of characters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmAscent
member.summary: The ascent (units above the base line) of characters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmDescent
member.summary: The descent (units below the base line) of characters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmInternalLeading
member.summary: The amount of leading (space) inside the bounds set by the tmHeight member. Accent marks and other diacritical characters may occur in this area. The designer may set this member to zero.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmExternalLeading
member.summary: The amount of extra leading (space) that the application adds between rows. Since this area is outside the font, it contains no marks and is not altered by text output calls in either OPAQUE or TRANSPARENT mode. The designer may set this member to zero.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmAveCharWidth
member.summary: The average width of characters in the font (generally defined as the width of the letter x). This value does not include overhang required for bold or italic characters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmMaxCharWidth
member.summary: The width of the widest character in the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmWeight
member.summary: The weight of the font.

summary.para: The extra width per string that may be added to some synthesized fonts. When synthesizing some attributes, such as bold or italic, graphics device interface (GDI) or a device may have to add width to a string on both a per-character and per-string basis. For example, GDI makes a string bold by expanding the spacing of each character and overstriking by an offset value; it italicizes a font by shearing the string. In either case, there is an overhang past the basic string. For bold strings, the overhang is the distance by which the overstrike is offset. For italic strings, the overhang is the amount the top of the font is sheared past the bottom of the font.

The tmOverhang member enables the application to determine how much of the character width returned by a GetTextExtentPoint32 function call on a single character is the actual character width and how much is the per-string extra width. The actual width is the extent minus the overhang.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmDigitizedAspectX
member.summary: The horizontal aspect of the device for which the font was designed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmDigitizedAspectY
member.summary: The vertical aspect of the device for which the font was designed. The ratio of the tmDigitizedAspectX and tmDigitizedAspectY members is the aspect ratio of the device for which the font was designed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmFirstChar
member.summary: The value of the first character defined in the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmLastChar
member.summary: The value of the last character defined in the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmDefaultChar
member.summary: The value of the character to be substituted for characters that are not in the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmBreakChar
member.summary: The value of the character to be used to define word breaks for text justification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmItalic
member.summary: An italic font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmUnderlined
member.summary: An underlined font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmStruckOut
member.summary: A strikeout font if it is nonzero.

summary.para: The pitch and family of the selected font. The low-order bit (bit 0) specifies the pitch of the font. If it is 1, the font is variable pitch (or proportional). If it is 0, the font is fixed pitch (or monospace). Bits 1 and 2 specify the font type. If both bits are 0, the font is a raster font; if bit 1 is 1 and bit 2 is 0, the font is a vector font; if bit 1 is 0 and bit 2 is set, or if both bits are 1, the font is some other type. Bit 3 is 1 if the font is a device font; otherwise, it is 0.

The four high-order bits designate the font family. The tmPitchAndFamily member can be combined with the hexadecimal value 0xF0 by using the bitwise AND operator and can then be compared with the font family names for an identical match. For more information about the font families, see LOGFONT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.tmCharSet
member.summary: The character set of the font.

summary.para: Specifies whether the font is italic, underscored, outlined, bold, and so forth. May be any reasonable combination of the following values.

item.term: no glyph in a font at any size has a negative A or C space.
font with a digital signature. This allows traceability and ensures that the font has been tested and is not corrupted

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.ntmSizeEM
member.summary: The size of the em square for the font. This value is in notional units (that is, the units for which the font was designed).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.ntmCellHeight
member.summary: The height, in notional units, of the font. This value should be compared with the value of the ntmSizeEM member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRIC.ntmAvgWidth
member.summary: The average width of characters in the font, in notional units. This value should be compared with the value of the ntmSizeEM member.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRICEX
member.summary: The NEWTEXTMETRICEX structure contains information about a physical font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRICEX.ntmTm
member.summary: A NEWTEXTMETRIC structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.NEWTEXTMETRICEX.ntmFontSig
member.summary: A FONTSIGNATURE structure indicating the coverage of the font.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC
member.summary: The OUTLINETEXTMETRIC structure contains metrics describing a TrueType font.

remarks.para: The sizes returned in OUTLINETEXTMETRIC are specified in logical units; that is, they depend on the current mapping mode of the specified display context.

Note, OUTLINETEXTMETRIC is defined using the current pack setting. To avoid problems, make sure that the application is built using the platform default packing. For example, 32-bit Windows uses a default of 8-byte packing. For more information, see the MSDN topic "C-Compiler Packing Issues".

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the OUTLINETEXTMETRIC structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmTextMetrics
member.summary: A TEXTMETRIC structure containing further information about the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmFiller
member.summary: A value that causes the structure to be byte-aligned.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmPanoseNumber
member.summary: The PANOSE number for this font.

summary.para: The nature of the font pattern. This member can be a combination of the following bits.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmfsType
member.summary: Indicates whether the font is licensed. Licensed fonts must not be modified or exchanged. If bit 1 is set, the font may not be embedded in a document. If bit 1 is clear, the font can be embedded. If bit 2 is set, the embedding is read-only.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmsCharSlopeRise
member.summary: The slope of the cursor. This value is 1 if the slope is vertical. Applications can use this value and the value of the otmsCharSlopeRun member to create an italic cursor that has the same slope as the main italic angle (specified by the otmItalicAngle member).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmsCharSlopeRun
member.summary: The slope of the cursor. This value is zero if the slope is vertical. Applications can use this value and the value of the otmsCharSlopeRise member to create an italic cursor that has the same slope as the main italic angle (specified by the otmItalicAngle member).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmItalicAngle
member.summary: The main italic angle of the font, in tenths of a degree counterclockwise from vertical. Regular (roman) fonts have a value of zero. Italic fonts typically have a negative italic angle (that is, they lean to the right).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmEMSquare
member.summary: The number of logical units defining the x- or y-dimension of the em square for this font. (The number of units in the x- and y-directions are always the same for an em square.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmAscent
member.summary: The maximum distance characters in this font extend above the base line. This is the typographic ascent for the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmDescent
member.summary: The maximum distance characters in this font extend below the base line. This is the typographic descent for the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmLineGap
member.summary: The typographic line spacing.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmsCapEmHeight
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmsXHeight
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmrcFontBox
member.summary: The bounding box for the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmMacAscent
member.summary: The maximum distance characters in this font extend above the base line for the Macintosh computer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmMacDescent
member.summary: The maximum distance characters in this font extend below the base line for the Macintosh computer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmMacLineGap
member.summary: The line-spacing information for the Macintosh computer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmusMinimumPPEM
member.summary: The smallest recommended size for this font, in pixels per em-square.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmptSubscriptSize
member.summary: The recommended horizontal and vertical size for subscripts in this font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmptSubscriptOffset
member.summary: The recommended horizontal and vertical offset for subscripts in this font. The subscript offset is measured from the character origin to the origin of the subscript character.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmptSuperscriptSize
member.summary: The recommended horizontal and vertical size for superscripts in this font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmptSuperscriptOffset
member.summary: The recommended horizontal and vertical offset for superscripts in this font. The superscript offset is measured from the character base line to the base line of the superscript character.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmsStrikeoutSize
member.summary: The width of the strikeout stroke for this font. Typically, this is the width of the em dash for the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmsStrikeoutPosition
member.summary: The position of the strikeout stroke relative to the base line for this font. Positive values are above the base line and negative values are below.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmsUnderscoreSize
member.summary: The thickness of the underscore character for this font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmsUnderscorePosition
member.summary: The position of the underscore character for this font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmpFamilyName
member.summary: The offset from the beginning of the structure to a string specifying the family name for the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmpFaceName
member.summary: The offset from the beginning of the structure to a string specifying the typeface name for the font. (This typeface name corresponds to the name specified in the LOGFONT structure.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmpStyleName
member.summary: The offset from the beginning of the structure to a string specifying the style name for the font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.OUTLINETEXTMETRIC.otmpFullName
member.summary: The offset from the beginning of the structure to a string specifying the full name for the font. This name is unique for the font and often contains a version number or other identifying information.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.PANOSE
member.summary: The PANOSE structure describes the PANOSE font-classification values for a TrueType font. These characteristics are then used to associate the font with other fonts of similar appearance but different names.

summary.para: For Latin fonts, one of one of the following values.
The serif style. For Latin fonts, one of the following values.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.POLYTEXT
member.summary: The POLYTEXT structure describes how the PolyTextOut function should draw a string of text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.POLYTEXT.x
member.summary: The horizontal reference point for the string. The string is aligned to this point using the current text-alignment mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.POLYTEXT.y
member.summary: The vertical reference point for the string. The string is aligned to this point using the current text-alignment mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.POLYTEXT.n
member.summary: The length of the string pointed to by lpstr.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.POLYTEXT.lpstr
member.summary: Pointer to a string of text to be drawn by the PolyTextOut function. This string need not be null-terminated, since n specifies the length of the string.

summary.para: Specifies whether the string is to be opaque or clipped and whether the string is accompanied by an array of character-width values. This member can be one or more of the following values.

item.term: The rectangle for each string is to be opaqued with the current background color.
Each string is to be clipped to its specified rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.POLYTEXT.rcl
member.summary: A rectangle structure that contains the dimensions of the opaquing or clipping rectangle. This member is ignored if neither of the ETO_OPAQUE nor the ETO_CLIPPED value is specified for the uiFlags member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.POLYTEXT.pdx
member.summary: Pointer to an array containing the width value for each character in the string.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RASTERIZER_STATUS
member.summary: The RASTERIZER_STATUS structure contains information about whether TrueType is installed. This structure is filled when an application calls the GetRasterizerCaps function.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RASTERIZER_STATUS.nSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the RASTERIZER_STATUS structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RASTERIZER_STATUS.wFlags
member.summary: Specifies whether at least one TrueType font is installed and whether TrueType is enabled. This value is TT_AVAILABLE, TT_ENABLED, or both if TrueType is on the system.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RASTERIZER_STATUS.nLanguageID
member.summary: The language in the system's Setup.inf file.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.WCRANGE
member.summary: The WCRANGE structure specifies a range of Unicode characters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.WCRANGE.wcLow
member.summary: Low Unicode code point in the range of supported Unicode code points.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.WCRANGE.cGlyphs
member.summary: Number of supported Unicode code points in this range.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.EnhMetaFileProc
member.summary: The EnhMetaFileProc function is an application-defined callback function used with the EnumEnhMetaFile function. The ENHMFENUMPROC type defines a pointer to this callback function. EnhMetaFileProc is a placeholder for the application-defined function name.
member.param: Handle to the device context passed to EnumEnhMetaFile.

Pointer to a HANDLETABLE structure representing the table of handles associated with the graphics objects (pens, brushes, and so on) in the metafile. The first entry contains the enhanced-metafile handle.
Pointer to one of the records in the metafile. This record should not be modified. (If modification is necessary, it should be performed on a copy of the record.)
Specifies the number of objects with associated handles in the handle table.
Pointer to optional data.
member.returns: This function must return a nonzero value to continue enumeration; to stop enumeration, it must return zero.
member.remarks: An application must register the callback function by passing its address to the EnumEnhMetaFile function.

summary.para: The EnumMetaFileProc function is an application-defined callback function that processes Windows-format metafile records. This function is called by the EnumMetaFile function. The MFENUMPROC type defines a pointer to this callback function. EnumMetaFileProc is a placeholder for the application-defined function name.

Note This function is provided only for compatibility with Windows-format metafiles. Enhanced-format metafiles provide superior functionality and are recommended for new applications. The corresponding function for an enhanced-format metafile is EnhMetaFileProc.

remarks.para: An application must register the callback function by passing its address to the EnumMetaFile function.
EnumMetaFileProc is a placeholder for the application-supplied function name.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType
member.summary: The RecordType enumeration defines values that uniquely identify records in an EMF metafile. These values are specified in the Type fields of EMF records (section 2.3).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_HEADER
member.summary: This record defines the start of the metafile and specifies its characteristics; its contents, including the dimensions of the embedded image; the number of records in the metafile; and the resolution of the device on which the embedded image was created. These values make it possible for the metafile to be device-independent.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYBEZIER
member.summary: This record defines one or more Bezier curves. Cubic Bezier curves are defined using specified endpoints and control points, and are stroked with the current pen.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYGON
member.summary: This record defines a polygon consisting of two or more vertexes connected by straight lines. The polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygon is closed automatically by drawing a line from the last vertex to the first.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYLINE
member.summary: This record defines a series of line segments by connecting the points in the specified array.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYBEZIERTO
member.summary: This record defines one or more Bezier curves based upon the current drawing position.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYLINETO
member.summary: This record defines one or more straight lines based upon the current drawing position. A line is drawn from the current drawing position to the first point specified by the points field by using the current pen. For each additional line, drawing is performed from the ending point of the previous line to the next point specified by points.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYPOLYLINE
member.summary: This record defines multiple series of connected line segments. The line segments are drawn by using the current pen. The figures formed by the segments are not filled. The current position is neither used nor updated by this record.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYPOLYGON
member.summary: This record defines a series of closed polygons. Each polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygons defined by this record can overlap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETWINDOWEXTEX
member.summary: This record defines the window extent.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETWINDOWORGEX
member.summary: This record defines the window origin.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETVIEWPORTEXTEX
member.summary: This record defines the viewport extent.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETVIEWPORTORGEX
member.summary: This record defines the viewport origin.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETBRUSHORGEX
member.summary: This record defines the origin of the current brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_EOF
member.summary: This record indicates the end of the metafile.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETPIXELV
member.summary: This record defines the color of the pixel at the specified logical coordinates.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETMAPPERFLAGS
member.summary: This record specifies parameters for the process of matching logical fonts to physical fonts, which is performed by the font mapper.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETMAPMODE
member.summary: This record defines the mapping mode, which defines the unit of measure used to transform page space units into device space units, and defines the orientation of the device's X and Y axes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETBKMODE
member.summary: This record defines the background mix mode, which is used with text, hatched brushes, and pen styles that are not solid lines.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETPOLYFILLMODE
member.summary: This record defines polygon fill mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETROP2
member.summary: This record defines binary raster operation mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETSTRETCHBLTMODE
member.summary: This record defines bitmap stretch mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETTEXTALIGN
member.summary: This record defines text alignment.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETCOLORADJUSTMENT
member.summary: This record defines the color adjustment values using the specified values.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETTEXTCOLOR
member.summary: This record defines the current text color.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETBKCOLOR
member.summary: This record defines the background color.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_OFFSETCLIPRGN
member.summary: This record redefines the current clipping region by the specified offsets.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_MOVETOEX
member.summary: This record defines coordinates of the new drawing position in logical units.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETMETARGN
member.summary: This record intersects the current clipping region with the current metaregion and saves the combined region as the new current metaregion.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_EXCLUDECLIPRECT
member.summary: This record defines a new clipping region that consists of the current clipping region intersected with the specified rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_INTERSECTCLIPRECT
member.summary: This record defines a new clipping region from the intersection of the current clipping region and the specified rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SCALEVIEWPORTEXTEX
member.summary: This record redefines the viewport using the ratios formed by the specified multiplicands and divisors.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SCALEWINDOWEXTEX
member.summary: This record redefines the window using the ratios formed by the specified multiplicands and divisors.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SAVEDC
member.summary: This record saves the current state of the playback device context (section 3.1) in an array of states saved by preceding EMR_SAVEDC records if any.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_RESTOREDC
member.summary: This record restores the playback device context to the specified state, which was saved by a preceding EMR_SAVEDC record (section 2.3.11).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETWORLDTRANSFORM
member.summary: This record defines a two-dimensional linear transform between world space and page space [MSDN-WRLDPGSPC].

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_MODIFYWORLDTRANSFORM
member.summary: This record redefines the world transform by using the specified mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SELECTOBJECT
member.summary: This record selects an object in the playback device context, which is identified by its index in the EMF object table (section 3.1.1.1).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_CREATEPEN
member.summary: This record defines a logical pen (section 2.2.19) that has the specified style, width, and color.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_CREATEBRUSHINDIRECT
member.summary: This record defines a logical brush for filling figures in graphics operations.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_DELETEOBJECT
member.summary: This record deletes a graphics object, clearing its index in the EMF object table.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_ANGLEARC
member.summary: This record defines a line segment of an arc. The line segment is drawn from the current drawing position to the beginning of the arc. The arc is drawn along the perimeter of a circle with the given radius and center. The length of the arc is defined by the given start and sweep angles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_ELLIPSE
member.summary: This record defines an ellipse. The center of the ellipse is the center of the specified bounding rectangle. The ellipse is outlined by using the current pen and is filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_RECTANGLE
member.summary: This record defines a rectangle. The rectangle is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_ROUNDRECT
member.summary: This record defines a rectangle with rounded corners. The rectangle is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_ARC
member.summary: This record defines an elliptical arc.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_CHORD
member.summary: This record defines a chord, which is a region bounded by the intersection of an ellipse and a line segment, called a secant. The chord is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_PIE
member.summary: This record defines a pie-shaped wedge bounded by the intersection of an ellipse and two radials. The pie is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SELECTPALETTE
member.summary: This record selects a LogPalette object (section 2.2.17) into the playback device context, identifying it by its index in the EMF object table.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_CREATEPALETTE
member.summary: This record defines a LogPalette object.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETPALETTEENTRIES
member.summary: This record defines RGB color values in a range of entries in a LogPalette object.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_RESIZEPALETTE
member.summary: This record increases or decreases the size of a logical palette.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_REALIZEPALETTE
member.summary: This record maps entries from the current logical palette to the system palette.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_EXTFLOODFILL
member.summary: This record fills an area of the display surface with the current brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_LINETO
member.summary: This record defines a line from the current drawing position up to, but not including, the specified point. It resets the current drawing position to the specified point.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_ARCTO
member.summary: This record defines an elliptical arc. It resets the current position to the endpoint of the arc.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYDRAW
member.summary: This record defines a set of line segments and Bezier curves.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETARCDIRECTION
member.summary: This record defines the drawing direction to be used for arc and rectangle operations.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETMITERLIMIT
member.summary: This record defines the limit for the length of miter joins.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_BEGINPATH
member.summary: This record opens a path bracket for specifying the current path.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_ENDPATH
member.summary: This record closes an open path bracket and selects the path into the playback device context.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_CLOSEFIGURE
member.summary: This record closes an open figure in a path.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_FILLPATH
member.summary: This record closes any open figures in the current path bracket and fills its interior by using the current brush and polygon-filling mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_STROKEANDFILLPATH
member.summary: This record closes any open figures in a path, strokes the outline of the path by using the current pen, and fills its interior by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_STROKEPATH
member.summary: This record renders the specified path by using the current pen.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_FLATTENPATH
member.summary: This record turns each curve in the path into a sequence of lines.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_WIDENPATH
member.summary: This record redefines the current path bracket as the area that would be painted if the path were stroked using the current pen.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SELECTCLIPPATH
member.summary: This record specifies a clipping region as the current clipping region combined with the current path bracket, using the specified mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_ABORTPATH
member.summary: This record aborts a path bracket or discards the path from a closed path bracket.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_GDICOMMENT
member.summary: This record specifies arbitrary private data.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_FILLRGN
member.summary: This record fills the specified region by using the specified brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_FRAMERGN
member.summary: This record draws a border around the specified region using the specified brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_INVERTRGN
member.summary: This record inverts the colors in the specified region.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_PAINTRGN
member.summary: This record paints the specified region by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_EXTSELECTCLIPRGN
member.summary: This record combines the specified region with the current clipping region, using the specified mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_BITBLT
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern, according to a specified raster operation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_STRETCHBLT
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern, according to a specified raster operation, stretching or compressing the output to fit the dimensions of the destination, if necessary.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_MASKBLT
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern and with the application of a color mask bitmap, according to specified foreground and background raster operations.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_PLGBLT
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination parallelogram, with the application of a color mask bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETDIBITSTODEVICE
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from specified scanlines of a source bitmap to a destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_STRETCHDIBITS
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern, according to a specified raster operation, stretching or compressing the output to fit the dimensions of the destination, if necessary.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_EXTCREATEFONTINDIRECTW
member.summary: This record defines a logical font that has the specified characteristics. The font can subsequently be selected as the current font.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_EXTTEXTOUTA
member.summary: This record draws an ASCII text string using the current font and text colors.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW
member.summary: This record draws a Unicode text string using the current font and text colors.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYBEZIER16
member.summary: This record defines one or more Bezier curves. The curves are drawn using the current pen.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYGON16
member.summary: This record defines a polygon consisting of two or more vertexes connected by straight lines. The polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygon is closed automatically by drawing a line from the last vertex to the first.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYLINE16
member.summary: This record defines a series of line segments by connecting the points in the specified array.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYBEZIERTO16
member.summary: This record defines one or more Bezier curves based on the current position.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYLINETO16
member.summary: This record defines one or more straight lines based upon the current position. A line is drawn from the current position to the first point specified by the Points field by using the current pen. For each additional line, drawing is performed from the ending point of the previous line to the next point specified by Points.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYPOLYLINE16
member.summary: This record defines multiple series of connected line segments.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYPOLYGON16
member.summary: This record defines a series of closed polygons. Each polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygons specified by this record can overlap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYDRAW16
member.summary: This record defines a set of line segments and Bezier curves.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_CREATEMONOBRUSH
member.summary: This record defines a logical brush with the specified bitmap pattern. The bitmap can be a device-independent bitmap (DIB) section bitmap or it can be a device-dependent bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_CREATEDIBPATTERNBRUSHPT
member.summary: This record defines a logical brush that has the pattern specified by the DIB.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_EXTCREATEPEN
member.summary: This record defines an extended logical pen (section 2.2.20) that has the specified style, width, color, and brush attributes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYTEXTOUTA
member.summary: This record draws one or more ASCII text strings using the current font and text colors. Note: EMR_POLYTEXTOUTA SHOULD be emulated with a series of EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW records, one per string.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_POLYTEXTOUTW
member.summary: This record draws one or more Unicode text strings using the current font and text colors. Note: EMR_POLYTEXTOUTW SHOULD be emulated with a series of EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW records, one per string.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETICMMODE
member.summary: This record specifies the mode of Image Color Management (ICM) for graphics operations.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_CREATECOLORSPACE
member.summary: This record creates a logical color space object from a color profile with a name consisting of ASCII characters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SETCOLORSPACE
member.summary: This record defines the current logical color space object for graphics operations.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_DELETECOLORSPACE
member.summary: This record deletes a logical color space object. Note: An EMR_DELETEOBJECT record SHOULD be used instead of EMR_DELETECOLORSPACE to delete a logical color space object.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_GLSRECORD
member.summary: This record specifies an OpenGL function.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_GLSBOUNDEDRECORD
member.summary: This record specifies an OpenGL function with a bounding rectangle for output.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_PIXELFORMAT
member.summary: This record specifies the pixel format to use for graphics operations.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_DRAWESCAPE
member.summary: This record passes arbitrary information to the driver. The intent is that the information results in drawing being done.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_EXTESCAPE
member.summary: This record passes arbitrary information to the driver. The intent is that the information does not result in drawing being done.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_SMALLTEXTOUT
member.summary: This record outputs a string.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_FORCEUFIMAPPING
member.summary: This record forces the font mapper to match fonts based on their UniversalFontId in preference to their LogFont information.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_NAMEDESCAPE
member.summary: This record passes arbitrary information to the given named driver.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.RecordType.EMR_COLORCORRECTPALETTE
member.summary: This record specifies how to correct the entries of a logical palette object using Windows Color System (WCS) 1.0 values.
